text: Kitty Kallen (born Katherine Kalinsky; May 25, 1921 - January 7, 2016) was an American popular singer whose career spanned from the 1930s to the 1960sâ€”to include the Swing era of the Big Band years. She was best known for her 1954 solo recording '"Little Things Mean a Lot". Kallen died on January 7, 2016 at her home in Cuernavaca, Mexico at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other websites== * Profile, discogs.com * Profile , artistdirect.com Category:1921 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:Singers from Pennsylvania Category:Actors from Philadelphia
title: Kitty Kallen
